gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.16/hr suggests supply chain stabilization after 2024 shortages, but elevated capex requirements continue to limit smaller players' access to premium compute infrastructure.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.28/1M signals intensified API price compression, forcing providers to optimize inference efficiency or risk losing market share in the increasingly commoditized LLM service layer.

gagl.text: 120 TWh annual load represents a substantial grid footprint equivalent to powering 10+ million homes, highlighting the urgent need for AI infrastructure to align with renewable energy transition and carbon reduction targets.

aipi.text: Converging cost pressures across hardware, tokens, and energy suggest the AI industry is maturing from growth-at-all-costs to sustainable profitability models, though bubble risks remain elevated in over-capitalized segments.
